creator: milind.velociter@gmail.com
text:
I have put my jar file in lib/junit folder.
Then I have run Junit and selected Junit request. I also checked check box of 'Search for Junit annotations'.
Then also it is not showing Class name of my jar file which is place in above mentioned folder.

Hello,
Can you provide a simple test plan and jar showing the issue ?
Please also provide:
- list of jars in lib
- list of jars in lib/ext
- jar -tvf <your jar that you have put in lib/junit>
- jmeter.log file 

Thank you

text: Check all list of attached files. Please let me know the solution asap.

Hello,
You import:
import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
import org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitDriver;

Which are not in your classpath (lib folder) so it most probably fails with a NoClassDefFoundError. 


Please, ask such questions on user mailing list.
Thanks
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
milind.velociter@gmail.com
text: Is there any solution for this?

creator: felix.schumacher@internetallee.de
text:
(In reply to milind.velociter from comment #8)
> Is there any solution for this?

Add the jars, that your program need.

For more help ask on the users mailing list.
http://jmeter.apache.org/mail2.html
